FuncDef: The display ipsec sa command displays information about a Security Association (SA).
CLIs: display ipsec sa [ vpn ] remote <remote-ip> [ slot <slot-id> ]
display ipsec sa [ vpn ] remote <remote-ip> [ slot <slot-id> [ engine <engine-id> | card <card-id> ] ]
display ipsec sa [ vpn-instance <vpn-instance-name> ] flow-destination <flow-destination-ip> <flow-destination-mask> [ slot <slot-id> [ engine <engine-id> | card <card-id> ] ]
display ipsec sa [ vpn-instance <vpn-instance-name> ] flow-destination <flow-destination-ip> <flow-destination-mask> [ slot <slot-id> ]

ParaDef.Info:
Indicates the VPN on the ciphertext side.
-

Specifies the IP address of a remote peer.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

Specifies a slot ID.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.

Specifies an engine ID.
The value is an integer that ranges from 0 to 1.

Specifies a card ID.
The value is an integer that ranges from 0 to 1.

Specifies the vpn-instance name that is used to find the SAs.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.

Specifies the IP address of flow destination.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

Specifies the IP address mask of flow destination.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

Examples: udp encapsulation used for nat traversal: N
udp encapsulation used for nat traversal: N
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
You can run the display ipsec sa command to check whether the SA configurations for outgoing protocol packets on the local end are identical with those for incoming protocol packets on the peer end. The display ipsec sa command output displays the following information:
SA nameSecurity proposal applied to the SANumber of times the SA is appliedSA configurations for incoming Authentication Header (AH)SA configurations for outgoing AHSA configurations for incoming Encapsulating Security Payload (ESP)SA configurations for outgoing ESP

Precautions
engine and card options are supported only on the VSU board.
